poem:
**Echoes in the Frost**

In the measured steps
of power, winters whisper
to stubborn leaders.

Scandals accumulate
like dirty snow.

Yet, somewhere,
a solitude envelops,
the necessity of silence
begging for remembrance,
whilst futures murmur
in the cold.

History's shadow falls,
asking whose prints 
will remain,
and whose will melt away.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
